info.abstract:
[Type] Metadata Access.
[Behaviour] It shows the list of the hierarchies or the description of a specified hierarchy.
[Parameters] - hierarchy : name of the requested hierarchy. If the value "all" is specified than the list of all hierarchies is shown. - hierarchy_version : version of the requested hierarchy. If not specified it will be used its default value "latest" in order to get info about the latest version of the hierarchy.
[System parameters] - exec_mode : operator execution mode. Possible values are async (default) for asynchronous mode, sync for synchronous mode with json-compliant output. - ncores : number of parallel processes to be used (min. 1). This operator is not parallel, so the only possible value is 1. - sessionid : session identifier used server-side to manage sessions and jobs. Usually users don't need to use/modify it, except when it is necessary to create a new session or switch to another one. - objkey_filter : filter on the output of the operator written to file (default=all => no filter, none => no output). hierarchy_list : show operator's output table; hierarchy_tip : show operator's output help message; hierarchy_attrs : show hierarchy attribute table; hierarchy_function : show hierarchy name and version.
[Examples] Get the description of "oph_time" hierarchy : OPH_TERM: oph_hierarchy hierarchy=oph_time; SUBMISSION STRING: "operator=oph_hierarchy;hierarchy=oph_time;"
